event: Earliest human settlement in present-day Denmark after Ice Age retreat
Neolithic societies build megalithic tombs and practice farming
Nordic Bronze Age culture flourishes with trade and metalwork
Iron Age societies establish villages and regional power centers
Early Danish kingdoms begin forming in southern Scandinavia
Viking Age begins with raids across Europe
Denmark emerges as a unified kingdom under Viking rulers
King Harald Bluetooth converts Denmark to Christianity
Danish rule briefly extends over England and the North Sea
Medieval monarchy consolidates power and builds stone churches
Kalmar Union unites Denmark, Norway, and Sweden under one crown
Denmark adopts Lutheran Protestantism during the Reformation
Territorial losses reduce Denmark’s regional dominance
Absolute monarchy is established
Denmark loses Norway after the Napoleonic Wars
Constitution establishes a constitutional monarchy
Defeat by Prussia reshapes Denmark’s modern borders
Nazi Germany occupies Denmark during World War II
Denmark is liberated and resumes democratic rule
Denmark joins the European Economic Community
